title: [CVE-2023-27531] Possible Deserialization of Untrusted Data vulnerability in Kredis JSON
content:
I made a report and patch at https://hackerone.com/reports/1702859 .
https://discuss.rubyonrails.org/t/cve-2023-27531-possible-deserialization-of-untrusted-data-vulnerability-in-kredis-json/82467
There is a deserialization of untrusted data vulnerability in the Kredis JSON deserialization code. This vulnerability has been assigned the CVE identifier CVE-2023-27531.
Impact
Carefully crafted JSON data processed by Kredis may result in deserialization of untrusted data, potentially leading to deserialization of unexpected objects in the system.
steps: Identify the Kredis JSON deserialization code in the application.
Craft malicious JSON data that, when deserialized, could lead to unexpected object deserialization.
Submit the crafted JSON data to the application via Kredis for processing.
Observe the application's behavior to confirm the deserialization of untrusted data.
vuln_description: The vulnerability involves the deserialization of untrusted JSON data in Kredis, which can lead to the deserialization of unexpected objects, potentially compromising the system's integrity.
reason: The vulnerability is straightforward to discover as it involves a common issue with JSON deserialization without proper validation. The attack does not require complex interactions or state manipulation, making it relatively easy to identify.
